item.title: Introduction
item.description: Although the audience is involved, there often is a separation between the audience and the artists on stage. In this work, we are exploring means to strengthen the connection between the audience and artists. We present a stage production aiming to integrate the audience into the process of aesthetic creation via physiological sensing. We call this approach “Boiling Mind”. To realize “Boiling Mind”, we expressed physiological signals from the audience during the performance via changes in common staging elements, such as projections, sound, and light elements.

item.title: Perfromance Details
item.description: Requirements In March 2020 we conducted three performances. The performances were advertised mentioning that we will be using the physiological signals and a brief introduction of what would be expected to happen during the performance. All the audience members were asked to read through the consent form on their seats (See Fig.\ref{fig:wrist} Left). By signing the form, they agreed to participate in this work and to offer their physiological data.

item.title: Implementation
item.description: The collected physiological data of the audience is transmitted to the server over WiFi. The server re-streams the processed data to other computers controlling each staging element. Sensing EDA and Heart Activity For this project we built wrist-worn devices measuring EDA from 2 electrodes on the fingers, and the heart rate using an optical blood volume pulse sensor. EDA signal was sampled at 4.545 Hz and the heart rate sensor at 50Hz.
